intro: Physaria hitchcockii subsp. hitchcockii, commonly known as the Hitchcock's bluestem, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert environments. It has a compact, mat-like growth form with hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers bloom in early spring and are pollinated by insects, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat.
